summary: This document is an email chain from July 29, 2020, between an unidentified individual and attorney Brad Edwards. The unidentified individual forwards a news article about an alleged Epstein 'recruiter' hiding in Los Angeles and expresses distress, claiming the recruiter knew what would happen to them after meeting Jeffrey Epstein. Edwards advises caution and strategic thinking regarding the recruiter's cooperation.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: He is the recipient of the email chain, advising an unidentified client to think strategically about the cooperation of an alleged Epstein recruiter and to stop reading sensational news.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE' by the unidentified email sender, who claims an alleged recruiter knew what would happen to them after meeting him.

connections.description: Edwards is providing legal advice to the sender, telling them to think through the implications of an alleged recruiter's cooperation for their claim.
The sender's statement ('what would happen to me after meeting JE') implies they were victimized by Epstein following an introduction.

events.title: Email Discussion on Recruiter's Cooperation
events.description: Brad Edwards and an unidentified client discuss via email the implications of an alleged Epstein sex ring recruiter cooperating with authorities, which Edwards suggests could be beneficial for the client's legal claim.

keyFacts: An alleged Epstein sex ring 'recruiter' was reported to be hiding in Los Angeles as of July 2020.
An unidentified individual claims this recruiter knew what would happen to them after they were introduced to Jeffrey Epstein.
Attorney Brad Edwards indicates the recruiter's cooperation could be beneficial for the individual's legal claim.
The email chain shows attorney-client communication regarding case strategy and media consumption.
